title: Have you baked bread, that has cracks upon its top?
statement: You have baked bread, that has cracks upon its top.
poem: morning blue sky--- / a bakery runs out / of croissants

title: Is there a ringing in your ears?
statement: There is a ringing in your.
poem: he rings in my ears / and gets louder when I try / to bury our love

title: Has a light suddenly and unaccountably been seen in a carpenter’s shop?
statement: A light has suddenly and unaccountably been seen in a carpenter’s shop.
poem: weight that shifts / with the news of a death / storm light

title: Have you opened an umbrella in your house?
statement: You have opened an umbrella in your house.
poem: my umbrella / flipped in the wind– / uncertain days

title: Has a bell rung of its own accord?
statement: A bell has been rung of its own accord?
poem: she bows lower / than all the others— / temple bell

title: Did anyone arrive at the funeral, after the procession had begun?
statement: Someone arrived at the funeral after the procession had begun.
poem: headlights— /a possum crouches / by the roadside

title: Has a hairpin fallen from your hair?
statement: A hairpin has fallen from your hair.
poem: rivulets of red / running down her pale young face / she clutches a doll

title: Did you keep a corpse in the house over Sunday?
statement: You kept a corpse in the house over Sunday.
poem: darkening skies -- / the final hours / of the weekend

title: Have you broken a looking-glass?
statement: You have broken a looking-glass.
poem: a discolored wall / where the mirror / used to be

title: Have scissors been left gaping on a table?
statement: Scissors have been left gaping on a table.
poem: cutting up red pepper / for the salad--- / a drop of blood

title: Has a dish-cloth been hung on a door-knob?
statement: A dish-cloth has been hung on a door-knob.
poem: doing the dishes - / a tiny soap bubble rises / toward heaven

title: Have you carried a hoe through your house?
statement: You have carried a hoe through your house.
poem: spring blossoms ... / the old farmer / coughs blood

title: Have you sneezed before breakfast on Sunday morning?
statement: You have sneezed before breakfast on Sunday morning.
poem: spring morning / one egg left / in the fridge

title: Have you laid down upon on a table?
statement: You have laid down upon on a table.
poem: morning sun / the crumbs on the table / have a shadow

title: Has there been singing at the table while your family is eating?
statement: There has been singing at the table while your family was eating.
poem: geriatric ward-- / the table groans / when they fold it up

title: Have three raps been heard?
statement: Three raps have been heard.
poem: insomnia / the rat trap / snapping shut

title: Have you seen a coffin in a candle?
statement: You have seen a coffin in a candle.
poem: candle drippings / on the epitaph- / a broken word

title: Have window-shades fallen without being molested?
statement: Window-shades have fallen without being molested.
poem: her empty nursery ... / a sudden breeze lifts / the floral curtains

title: Have you seen a flower bloom out season?
statement: You have seen a flower bloom out season.
poem: long illness – / pink dogwood blooming / without me

title: Were sparks unintentionally left in the ashes over night?
statement: Sparks were unintentionally left in the ashes over night.
poem: wild fires / in the mist / the ashes

title: Has a long motionless clock suddenly begun to tick?
statement: Has a long motionless clock suddenly begun to tick?
poem: lone guest gone – / the ticking / of the parlor clock

title: Have you tied on a bonnet?
statement: Have you tied on a bonnet?
poem: first date -- / wondering if the hat / is too much

title: Have you worked on a sick person's dress?
statement: Have you worked on a sick person's dress?
poem: dusk- / an unfinished sweater / on the rocking chair

title: Have you danced on the ground?
statement: Have you danced on the ground?
poem: heat lightning— / the first drop of sweat / on her chin

title: During sickness, have you dropped shears that have stuck into the ground?
statement: During sickness, have you dropped shears that have stuck into the ground?
poem: social distancing / our new neighbour / sharpens the scythe

title: Have you looked into a looking-glass while a corpse is in your house?
statement: Have you looked into a looking-glass while a corpse is in your house?
poem: bathroom mirror / always a stranger / in my place

title: Did rain fall into an open grave?
statement: Did rain fall into an open grave?
poem: winter rain / the sheets where she slept / grow colder

title: Did you pass through a funeral procession?
statement: Did you pass through a funeral procession?
poem: plastic bags / trapped on barbed wire / roadside cross

title: Has a corpse passed over the same road twice?
statement: Has a corpse passed over the same road twice?
poem: year's end / there's a hearse / in the fast lane

title: Have the eyes of a corpse opened of their own accord?
statement: Have the eyes of a corpse opened of their own accord?
poem: near the wall / of the cemetery / a condom
